abstract.para: This book covers the use of the CNotes extension. It does not cover any other extension available on compojoom.com .

section.title: Introducing CNotes
section.para: CNotes is a Joomla! extension & module that lets your users create private notes on each & every page of your site.

CNotes was developed as part of the "Joomla extension development masterclass" in July 2012. Together with our students we've explored the Joomla framework and have build something that is hopefully useful to you as well! If you want to learn how to build Joomla extensions on your own, maybe you should visit dothewebinar.com and book the next free webinar!

listitem.para: add private notes on every page of the site (provided that the cnotes is published on that pages)
notes are added without page refresh
user can add/edit/delete notes in the frontend
administrator can view/edit/delete notes in the backend

chapter.title: Installation and updates
chapter.para: Installing CNotes is no different than installing any other Joomla!™ extension on your site. You can read the complete instructions for installing Joomla!™ extensions on the official help page .Throughout this chapter we assume that you are familiar with these instructions and we will not duplicate them.

section.title: Getting the installation packages
section.para: You can download the latest installation packages by visiting our site at https://compojoom.com. Go to Download -> CNotes menu item. The releases are listed in descending order with the newest release always on top. Click on the release number and then download the ZIP package.

section.title: Checking for the latest version and upgrading
section.para: You can easily check for the latest published version of Cnotes by visiting https://compojoom.com and going to Downloads->CNotes.

Updating CNotes to the latest version is by no means different than installing the component! You do not have to uninstall the previous version; in fact, you are discouraged from doing so. Simply follow the installation instructions so as to install the latest CNotes version over the existing installation. That's all! All your settings are preserved.

section.title: Live update
section.para: There is also an alternate update path, if your server supports it. It is called the "Live Update" feature (thanks to Nicholas K. Dionysopoulos from http://akeebabackup.com) . Whenever you click on the Live update button in the Navigation toolbar, it will automatically check for the existence of an updated version and it will notify you. Clicking on the update button allows you to perform a live update without further interaction. Do note that if your server is protected by a firewall you'll have to enable port 80 and 443 TCP traffic to https://compojoom.com for this feature to work properly.

chapter.title: Using the CNotes component
chapter.para: Congrats! It seems that you have the first step - the installation behind you! Now to allow your users to add notes you should go to Extensions -> Module Manager and here you should publish the CNotes module. The module should not be published to the general public, but to your registered users!

section.title: The Backend
section.para: Once logged into your Joomla backend you can access the component by clicking on Components -> CNotes . You'll be presented with a list of all notes entered by your users. Using the edit & delete buttons at the top you can edit & delete any note you want.

section.title: Frontend
section.para: If you have the CNotes module published your users will be able to write notes and view the notes that they wrote on any page. Now on each page they can see only the notes that they wrote there. If you want to make their live easier you can provide them with a link to all their notes. To do so you have to create a new menu link. In the Joomla backend go to Menus -> Your-menu-> "Add new menu item" . In the "menu item type" field click on Select and then click on "User notes". (make this link available only to user registered users). Now when you click on the link you should see screen similar to this one (provided that you've written any notes)

Clicking on the delete button will delete the note. Clicking on the title will send the user to the page where he wrote the note. And clicking on the title will bring them to a screen where they can edit their note:

chapter.title: Using the CNotes Module
chapter.para: The CNotes module allows your users to create new notes in the frontend of your sites & it also gives them a quick look at the notes that they've written on the page that they are currently on. To publish the module you'll have to login into your Joomla Backend -> go to Extension manager -> Module manager. Here click on new and then look for "CNotes - user notes" -> select the desired position and publish the module to your registered users.
If the user has a note on the current page the module will show him that note. If you click on the title of the note you'll be presented with an edit screen and you'll be able to modify your note.

section.title: SEF & non-SEF urls
section.para: When the user browses to a specific page we try to show him the notes that he has on that page. We do that by comparing the current URL with anything in the CNotes table that matches that URL & user id. That works in 99% of the cases, but if your URL scheme changes for some reason (like you go from non-SEF URL to SEF URL, or you start to use a new SEF extension) the module won't be able to properly match the notes for the page. However -> the user will be still able to see the notes in the "User notes" view of the component.
